page.title: 09QUARRY/REFUSE TIP GREENSIDE
page.content: The quarry at Greenside has been in use since 1935. Five trucks work 8 hours a day throughout the year. They extract 1000 to 2000 tonnes of sand per day which is mainly used for building purposes. The deep holes made by digging out sand are now being filled with refuse from Newcastle and Gateshead. They have been using the site for 15 years. 2000 tonnes of refuse are tipped there every week. 100 - 150 lorries go there and they are not small lorries as each one can hold 12 tonnes of refuse. Green nets cover the lorries as they are driving to the tip. Bulldozers flatten the rubbish.When one hole is filled a layer of soil is put on top and grass seed is sown. As soon as the grass is established framers can use the land for grazing. After 21 years building procedures can be taken.
